subject: Education
title: The Zeigarnik Effect: Unfinished Business Sticks
description: A short lesson to help you apply The Zeigarnik Effect: Unfinished Business Sticks.

hook.text: A waitress remembers complex ordersâ€”until the bill is paid. Then the details vanish instantly.

buildup.text: Bluma Zeigarnik noticed that interrupted tasks are remembered better than completed ones.

discovery.text: Unfinished tasks create mental tension that keeps the information active in working memory.

twist.text: Cliffhangers in TV shows exploit thisâ€”your brain refuses to let go of the unresolved plot.

climax.text: Starting a study task and deliberately pausing keeps your brain processing it in the background.

punchline.text: Your brain holds onto what isn't finished yet.

quiz.question: What does the Zeigarnik effect demonstrate?
options: Interrupted tasks are remembered better than completed ones
Completed tasks create the strongest and most lasting memories
Memory works best when all tasks are done in one sitting
